Announcing Abnormal Document Activity Monitoring (ADAM)
Would your firm want to know if an attorney was planning a lateral move or a staff member was accessing an unusually high volume of client information? With our Abnormal Document Activity Monitoring (ADAM) solution, organizations can quickly identify and address irregularities that may point to bigger problems.
ADAM provides a straightforward way for firms to passively track DMS activity and monitor trends. By setting configurable alert thresholds, management can receive notifications and respond quickly when user behavior strays outside of the ordinary.
We held a webinar for this product in June, and since interest was so high, we will be holding a second webinar on August 1st. You can register at http://www.intapp.com/reg/webinarregister.html.

Getting the Most out of Integration Builder
Many firms have a long list of projects they’d like to tackle with their IntApp appliance. Unfortunately, the critical staff members they rely on to design and create integrations are often over-burdened and need help jumpstarting development. Fortunately, that help is available. Look to IntApp and our certified partners for assistance building integration solutions. Whether you are tight on technical resources or want to leverage the experience and skill of an expert consultant with legal application and business process familiarity, IntApp has a program to get your integration development off the ground. In June, IntApp announced Collaborative Integration Development (CID) and Integration Boot Camp (IBC). These programs offer "deep dive" training focused on your priority projects. Both are tailored to help you design, scope, and begin implementing your integration projects. If you were unable to attend our June customer webinar and would like more information about CID or IBC, please contact your account manager.
